definition: role (theater)/to compete/ancient three legged wine vessel/third note of pentatonic scale
angle/corner/horn/horn-shaped/unit of money equal to 0.1 yuan, or 10 cents (a dime)/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: In Chinese mythology, the Licorne is an auspicious objects.
sentences.chinese: 在中国神话中，独角兽是一种吉祥之物。

sentences.english: Unicorns come from the world of fantasy.
sentences.chinese: 独角兽是来自于幻想的世界。

sentences.english: "Here, unicorn, " said the man, and he pulled up a lily and gave it to him.
sentences.chinese: 他说独角兽的前额正中有一只金色的犄角。

sentences.english: There are many different forms of the Licorne statement.
sentences.chinese: 关于独角兽的形态有很多不同的说法。

sentences.english: When world peace will be better when Chongxian Licorne.
sentences.chinese: 当世界和平美好时独角兽将会重现。

sentences.english: Licorne is the legend of a mysterious animal.
sentences.chinese: 独角兽，是传说中的一种神秘的动物。
“那只独角兽，”他说道，“吃了一朵百合花。”

sentences.english: I'll be a lost glade in which unicorns still play.
sentences.chinese: 我愿成为一片丢失的林中空地，独角兽在此玩耍。
“去掉独角兽，”我斩钉截铁的说。

sentences.english: I often dream about unicorns and dragons.
sentences.chinese: 我常常梦见独角兽和龙。

sentences.english: "He told me it had a golden horn in the middle of its forehead," she said.
sentences.chinese: 他说独角兽的前额正中有一只金色的犄角。

sentences.english: We use unicorn hairs, phoenix tail feathers, and the heartstrings of dragons.
sentences.chinese: 我们使用独角兽毛，凤凰尾羽毛，和龙的心弦。

sentences.english: But water is toxic, and they dare not drink until one Licorne there.
sentences.chinese: 但是水是有毒的，它们不敢喝，直至一独角兽出现。

sentences.english: The Lion beat the Unicorn all around the town.
sentences.chinese: 狮子把独角兽打得落花流水。

sentences.english: Formidable hybrid of unicorn and Pegasus.
sentences.chinese: 独角兽和飞马令人生畏的混血。

definition: breeding/to incubate/innovation (esp. in commerce and marketing)
air vent/drafty place/wind gap (geology)/tuyere (furnace air nozzle)
Aladdin, character in one of the tales in the The Book of One Thousand and One Nights
(bird species of China) common raven (Corvus corax)

Ali (proper name)/Imam Ali ibn Abu Talib (c. 600-661), cousin, aid and son-in-law of the Prophet Mohammed 穆罕默德, the fourth Caliph 哈里發|哈里发 of Islam, reigned 656-661, and the first Imam 伊瑪目|伊玛目 of Shia Islam/Ngari prefecture in Tibet, Tibetan: Mnga' ris
celestial horse (mythology)/fine horse/Ferghana horse/(western mythology) Pegasus
